sections.title: Welcome to Marky
sections.description: Marky is a powerful Markdown editor that helps you create beautifully formatted content with ease. This guide will help you master Markdown syntax and make the most of our features.

sections.title: Basic Text Formatting
sections.description: Format your text using simple Markdown syntax for emphasis and styling.
sections.examples:
*italic text* or _italic text_
**bold text** or __bold text__
***bold and italic***
~~strikethrough text~~

sections.title: Headers
sections.description: Create headings of different levels using hash symbols (#).
sections.examples:
# Heading 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3
#### Heading 4
##### Heading 5
###### Heading 6

sections.title: Lists
sections.description: Create ordered and unordered lists with easy-to-use syntax.
sections.examples:
Unordered list:
- Item 1
- Item 2
  - Nested item

Ordered list:
1. First item
2. Second item
   1. Nested item

sections.title: Links and Images
sections.description: Add links to websites and insert images into your content.
sections.examples:
Link: [Link text](https://example.com)
Image: ![Alt text](image-url.jpg)
Linked image: [![Alt text](image-url.jpg)](https://example.com)

sections.title: Code Formatting
sections.description: Format code snippets and add syntax highlighting.

sections.title: Blockquotes
sections.description: Create blockquotes for citations or highlighted content.
sections.examples:
> Single quote
>> Nested quote
>>> Deep nested quote

sections.title: Tables
sections.description: Create structured tables with column alignment.

sections.title: Export Options
sections.description: Marky supports multiple export formats for your convenience:
sections.examples:
- Rich Text: Formatted preview with styling
- HTML: Clean HTML output
- XML: Structured XML format
- JSON: Parsed markdown tokens
- Plain Text: Raw text without formatting
- Word (.docx): Microsoft Word document

sections.title: Cloud Storage
sections.description: Connect with your favorite cloud storage providers to save and load your documents:

sections.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
sections.description: Speed up your workflow with these helpful keyboard shortcuts:
sections.examples:
Ctrl/Cmd + B: Bold
Ctrl/Cmd + I: Italic
Ctrl/Cmd + K: Insert link
Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + V: Paste as plain text

sections.title: Tips and Best Practices
sections.description: Follow these guidelines for better Markdown documents:
sections.examples:
1. Use consistent formatting
2. Include blank lines between sections
3. Use proper header hierarchy
4. Add descriptive alt text to images
5. Specify language for code blocks
